intro: Pygeum grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered African dogwood, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cornaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape.
